name: High Flow Velocity/Shear
functionStatement: Peak flows reshape channel without chronic instability, redistribute wood and sediment, reset habitats, and supply nutrients to floodplains.
descriptionMarkdown: Bankfull floods do not cause excessive scour/fill; channel handles transport without frequent failures.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Widespread bank retreat, channel shifts, or large sediment deposits after moderate flows.
Criteria: Extreme mismatch; chronic instability

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Velocity and shear noticeably too high or too low. Bars grow, shift, or scour around structures after moderate flows.
Criteria: Significant mismatch; frequent instability

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Small scour spots or minor deposition in a few places.
Criteria: Slight mismatch; occasional instability

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Velocity and shear match what the bed can resist. Only small bar tweaks or thin new deposits.
Criteria: Near threshold; stable
